title: Andrés F. Ramírez-Mejía
text:
Hi!
I’m postdoctoral researcher of CONICET at the Institute of Regional Ecology in Tucumán, Argentina. I was born in Colombia and started my career hoping to become an agronomist, but somehow I ended up as a biologist interested in mammalian ecology. In 2018 I got a Ph.D. fellowship by CONICET to study crop pollination at Northwestern Argentina; since then, I have been enjoying asado, mate, empanadas and, of course, the 40 °C during Tucumán’s summer.
I built this website to share my work and my general interests outside academic formality.


My current research
Currently, I am interested in combining different modeling approaches and field experiments to understand how spatial patterns affect biodiversity and ecosystem services in agricultural landscapes of Northern Argentina. I’m mainly studying: the effect of animal pollination on several productive metrics of the crop; optimal pollination thresholds to maximize blueberry production; individual and population effectiveness of pollinators; and cascading processes affecting pollination service in blueberry crops.


My research interests

Crop pollination
Pollination ecology
Bats
Functional diversity
Statistics
R programming

I’m interested in understanding how spatial patterns modulate the functional responses of animals and the resulting effect on ecosystem processes.


What I like/love

Biking.
Reading (Dostoyevski, García Márquez, Sábato, and Vasili Grossman are personal friends).
Asado –or BBQ in english– (Despite the ethical conflict inside me, I’m a big meat eater).
Dark beer (preferably Stout).
Animals in general, but particularly bats, cats and dogs.
